column4: Hello. I can't kill process on 11.10 and consider reporting a bug. Can someone tell me what should I include in this report to make it useful?
compiz
Don't I need some info about kernel? It seems to be the kernel problem.
Top says that compiz is in 'R' state
and it just ignores kill -9
you might try switching window managers (metacity --replace, compiz --replace)  just a suggestion
Hmm, that might work, but i have no idea how to do it - I currently have 2 guest sessions running compiz at 100%, and I'm not logged in neither of them.
I can su to those guest, but then when I try metacity --replace I get Window manager error: Unable to open X display :0
how are you trying to kill compiz?
sudo kill -9 15384
where 15384 is the pid
ok, how about killall compiz?
well, even if it does have multiple processes, shouldn
well, even if it does have multiple processes, shouldn't the 15384 be killed anyways?
pkill and killall haven't worked
I did sudo /etc/init.d/lightdm restart
I believe it restarts X server as well?
or what about killall -9 compiz
doesn't work.
Well, It seems like the program isn't the problem - all of them return 0, so kernel seems to accept the signal
and something is wrong on the kernel part?
the answer here says you can't kill compiz when the Launcher or Unity is running, maybe that's the problem? http://askubuntu.com/questions/47022/how-to-kill-unity-panel-unity-launcher
hmm, I'm not sure what are the process names of Unity and Launcher, but "ps ax | grep -i unity" lists no processes
